text:
<svg viewBox="0 0 70 12">
	<text font-size="12" font-family="Time-Roman" fill="cmyk(1,0,0,0)" 
text-anchor="start">TEXT text </text>
</svg>

Throws an exception in squiggle. In acrobat view text just shows up black
creator: tasha.zahnd@hp.com
deweese@apache.org
text:
Any reason you think this should work?
Batik supports rgb(...), I don't think a conformant SVG viewer is
required to support cmyk (how do you transform it to sRGB?).

Batik does not handle cmyk functions because this is not part of CSS or SVG. I
am closing this issue as the Batik processor has taken the option to notify the
user of errors rather than ignoring syntactical errors.
creator: vincent.hardy@sun.com
